item.title: MINEX III Certification by NIST
item.description: In collaboration with the Imprensa Nacional-Casa da Moeda (INCM), our work obtained MINEX III certification - Minutiae Interoperability Exchange - by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) of the United States (US) Department of Commerce. This certification is a test used to establish that template generation and correspondence algorithms comply with the US government’s Personal Identity Verification (PIV) program and aims to assess the quality and robustness of biometric recognition algorithms.

item.title: Best reviewer award at IJCB2020
item.description: The 2020 International Joint Conference on Biometrics (IJCB 2020) combines two major biometrics research conferences, the Biometrics Theory, Applications and Systems (BTAS) conference and the International Conference on Biometrics (ICB).

item.title: Monitor in the Future of Computing Summer School.
item.description: Monitor in the GPU-Accelerated Computing workshop given by Cristiana Dinea from NVIDIA Deep Learning Institute. Check more at Future of Computing summer school website.

item.title: About me
item.description: I’m Ana Rebelo, born in Porto, Portugal, in 1985. I graduated in Mathematics Applied to Technology at School of Sciences of University of Porto, Portugal, in 2007. I received the M.Sc. degree in Mathematical Engineering from the same school, in 2008. In 2008, I started my PhD studies at School of Engineering of University of Porto, Portugal. I have been working since 2007 as a researcher at INESC TEC, an R&D institute affiliated to University of Porto, in the Visual Computing and Machine Intelligence Group.

item.title: Activity
item.description: Research & Development Team Leader and individual contributor in vCardID project with INCM (Imprensa Nacional Casa da Moeda) for the creation of a national fingerprint identification algorithm. Principal Investigator in AUTOMOTIVE (FCT 030707). Member of the research project OMR (FCOMP-01-0124-FEDER-010159). Co-Founding and Coordinating Summer School VISion Understanding and Machine intelligence Summer School is a non-profit summer school that aims to gather Ph.D. candidates, Post-Doctoral scholars and researchers from academia and industry with research interests in computer vision and machine intelligence.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Contact me: ana dot m dot rebelo at inesctec dot pt
